Articles.Content:
Hi, I recently bought KSP from Steam, but it takes over an hour to fully open and crashes when I launch a rocket, or when I just press an option, it takes a lot to respond, I don't have any mods installed or something so, just the game. By the way, this is the data from my RAM:

Windows 10 Home Single Language
Processor:   Intel(R) Celeron(R) CPU  N2840  @ 2.16GHz   2.16 GHz
RAM:    2,00 GB (usable: 1,89 GB)
System:  x64

So, I was wondering if there is any way to solve or alleviate this, or if the problem is RAM, if there is another previous version of the game that it could be compatible with.

1 hour ago, _Isaac_ said:

RAM:    2,00 GB (usable: 1,89 GB)
 

You need at least 4 GB to have any chance of running KSP.

I’m surprised your PC can even run Windows 10 without crashing any time you open a new program; my old laptop was using 2.3GB (of 4) just to sit on the desktop with no programs running and my current PC idles at about 3GB (of 32). 2GB is no RAM at all, KSP requires 4GB and realistically you’ll want more than that to run it at a usable speed.

Edited September 28, 2021 by jimmymcgoochie
